productTitle: Vavra, Celtic Lap Harp - 26 wire strings, Sapele
productLongDesc:
Beautiful, rich, sounds emanate from this small harp. The tone wood qualities of the African Mahogany (Sapele) give it a rich and resonant voice with volume that compares to larger harps. The luster comes from the fine hand rubbed finish. The hand-carved Celtic scroll vines along the neck, pillar, and sides. It is strung with 26 wire strings, C3 to G6. Its about 32" tall, 25" deep, 13" wide and weighs about 13#. Can be fitted with sharping levers for semitone control.

The Universal levers shown in the photo have been removed (didn't like them) and can be replaced with Rees levers for an additional $208.00.

productTitle: Celtic Harp, 36 strings, Rharp Merlin, Mahogany
productLongDesc: Celtic Harp, 36 strings, Rharp Merlin, with Loveland levers, with padded travel case, features 8-sided coopered maple staveback, Aircraft-quality birch soundboard (5 laminates per 1/8 inch), Baltic birch neck and column, Mahogany and nitrocellulose finish. Almost Brand new. Amazing sound. $4500cad obo

productTitle: Lyon & Healy Gold 17, semi grand, stock photo
productLongDesc: Gold 17, semi grand, built in 1940. 46 strings. New neck, re-revited, soundboard enforced. $19,000cad bright yet warm sound.

The ElectroAcoustic harp is for performance harpists who want the flexibility of both an acoustic and an amplified harp, there is Lyon & Healy’s Style 2000 Electroacoustic harp. The electroacoustic harp produces sound through the use of transducers on each of the harp's strings. The result of this technology is an amplified harp which emits a reproduction of an acoustic sound in its natural state-the classic Lyon & Healy sound.

Vixen Harps has been supplying Canada with harps since 1994, and we take special care to ensure that every item you order from us reaches you promptly and safely. We are delighted to offer our local clients direct door-to-door home delivery, throughout both Ontario and Quebec.

productTitle: A beautiful bronzed Lyon & Healy Style 15
productLongDesc:
• ~ DOB 1930s
  • ~ TOS Fall 2004
  • ~ N.B. It is a well-known fact that the LH harps in the 3000s range are the best era of LH harp construction. Harps with these serial numbers are highly coveted for their sound and superb mechanism. This was the “golden era” of harp building by LH.
  • ~ Purchased by Vixen Harps in the summer of 2004, this harp was sent to PRD from IN (where it originated) to be totally rebuilt, excluding the neck.
  • ~ This harp has been totally rebuilt by PRD (Pat Dougal) of Joliet, IL. It received a new base, new soundboard, new reriveting, and a new bronzing.
  • ~ This harp was sent back to Ottawa in 2004, and resent back to PRD for further work, such as new neck, bronzing and more touch-up work.
  • ~ This harp has been in Ottawa since and rarely used. It was moved only once to play in Church and stayed at home since that date.
  • ~ Asking Price: CA$15,000.00

productTitle: Rare Charles Lindeman Harp - Gold Semi-Grand(1920s or 1930s)
productLongDesc:
A fixer-upper. This harp is not playable. Can ship to US or Canada. Contact seller to see this historically important harp over Zoom/Skype/Facetime.


More details: Extreme cracking in the sound-board. Can not be pulled up to pitch. Pedals work ok. Gold has flaked off in a couple of areas. 44 Strings.


Charles Lindeman, (b Chicago, c1881). American harp maker. He worked as a toolmaker for Lang & Heckenlauer in Chicago, where he learnt to repair pedal harps under the direction of Cyrus Heckenlauer, a former employee of Erard in Europe. At the age of 24, Lindeman set up his own business as C.A. Lindeman Harp Manufacturer (6224 Peterson Avenue, Chicago), and later as the Lindeman Harp Company. (from Oxford Music online)

productShortDesc: The Chicago Petite 40, designed by Lyon & Healy. In the spirit of the modern skyline of its namesake, the Chicago Petite 40 has a neoclassical style and...
productLongDesc:
The Chicago Petite 40, designed by Lyon & Healy. In the spirit of the modern skyline of its namesake, the Chicago Petite 40 has a neoclassical style and design. Built with a Sitka Spruce soundboard and Hard Maple body, the Chicago Petite 40 has a clear and dependable sound. The soundboard is decorated with a beautiful climbing vine and the mechanism features solid brass action plates. An ease to play with an unmatched value, the Chicago Petite 40 is the perfect partner for the harpist in the pursuit of expressive musicianship.

40 Strings: 1st octave E to 6th octave A
Height: 65 3/8” (166 cm)
Soundboard Width: 15” (38 cm)
Extreme Width: 35” (89 cm)
Weight: 62 lbs (28 Kg)

The Chicago Petite 40, designed by Lyon & Healy. In the spirit of the modern skyline of its namesake, the Chicago Petite 40 has a neoclassical style and design. Built with a Sitka Spruce soundboard and Hard Maple body, the Chicago Petite 40 has a clear and dependable sound. The soundboard is decorated with a beautiful climbing vine and the mechanism features solid brass action plates. An ease to play with an unmatched value, the Chicago Petite 40 is the perfect partner for the harpist in the pursuit of expressive musicianship.
